course_title: Jr/Sr Colloquium: Europe: Political Culture/Ancient Rome
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 8 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as CL 487W 1)


Focuses on the political culture of ancient Rome, especially between the second century BCE to the second century CE. Studies the various aspects of the Roman constitutions of in the Republican and the Imperial periods. Explores the conceptualizations of freedom, citizenship, honor and dishonor, and authority. Examines the mechanisms to distribute, reinforce, increase, and curb power, privileges, and obligations.
course_description: All history majors except those who complete the Honors Program must take two colloquia (HIST 487, 488 or 489). Each colloquium treats a special theme by reading, discussion, and writing of papers. Enrollment in each is limited to twelve; non-majors are welcome within space limitations.
sections: Class Nbr: 3737, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 4-6:45p, Instructor: J. Liu, Status: Open
